text: Yeah that's definitely not working <@U26B530N6>. I'll get a link for you to take a look.

How do we customize formatting on the new Search Results page? I've updated CSS that is attached to the template, but the changes aren't going into effect. Unless this is another issue of the CSS having delays due to caching??

<@U26C29XPH> I have duplicated both modules “Search Form” and “Search Result” and added CSS inside them
<https://www.captaincontrat.com/recherche?term=contrat&length=SHORT&limit=20>
Thanks <@U3TR96G84> looks like it was just a delay in HubSpot or the cache updating as it's rendering properly now.
:grinning: that s why I allways test my webpage with ?12 or other query To force cache. But you re right the HubSpot cache la Very persistent :)

_Inserting shameless chrome extension promotion:_ <@U26C29XPH> <@U3TR96G84> the technique Loic suggested with adding a query parameter. We built a chrome extension that give’s you quick access to do exactly that, among other things. <https://spin.d.pr/ak3W9+>

If you’re interested in it here it is in the Chrome Web Store: <http://spin.d.pr/Z61sgv>

If interested in giving feedback on it or want to contribute hit us up in <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension>
